channel.title: Artificial Intelligence
channel.description: Do the Npc AI's work on moparclassic? If not, how would I get them to work?

item.title: Artificial Intelligence
item.dc:creator: @ggallin ggallin
item.description:
@ggallin wrote:

Lothy:

Putting them in the client is a bad idea. Instead of updating the position of every npc every game tick though, only npcs close to a player should move around. Obviously you need to increase the npc’s hp/stats once a minute or so though (i.e., to undo the effects of stun type spells).

not to mention the risk of the client being tampered with to spawn/kill npcs. (The risk to multiplayer servers)

Read full topic

item.title: Artificial Intelligence
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Putting them in the client is a bad idea. Instead of updating the position of every npc every game tick though, only npcs close to a player should move around. Obviously you need to increase the npc’s hp/stats once a minute or so though (i.e., to undo the effects of stun type spells).

Read full topic

item.title: Artificial Intelligence
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

The traditional AI and AI within games are very different. While the former is used to solve a real problem of some kind (for instance, an agent that interacts with a human being), the latter is only used to create the illusion of intelligence.

In games, all you would need is a bunch of if-else statements or a switch statement. But often a finite state machine is used.

So, yes, I would consider this some kind of AI. A very primitive one at that.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:28, topic:455116”]spoiler: npcs are controlled by the game server, they know of the player’s location and pretty much every resource. nothing has to be sensed out like an organism - it isn’t AI.[/quote]i control my npcs in the client bro, it takes stress off the server, so i move them on the client only.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

What would you like to see an npc do?

Something like Npc “A” spawned near tons of Npc “B”, then A starts killing them and getting stronger each minute while B keep spawning. The goal should kill Npc A as soon as possible before it gets unbeatable.

I was thinking of spawning elvarg in wild surrounded by tons of hobs and make its dragon fire hit multiple targets so it could get more exp by minute. Maybe set exp to 1k from each hobs killed by him.

Another thing could be making the Npc spawn a decoy npc so he starts ranging/maging at you while recovering some health, something similar to what the necromancer do.

Read full topic
